title.narrative: REACH Food & NFI assistance for new IDPs in Erbil

description.narrative:
This project will support CA partner REACH to provide emergency food and non-food assistance (kerosene), which have been identified as priority needs in initial assessments, to displaced households in Erbil to cover priority needs. The project will target 882 displaced households (5292 ppl) with food assistance and non-food item assistance. Relief items will be distributed in coordination with local IDP leaders, government officials and other key humanitarian agencies.
The activities include providing needed support for vulnerable IDP families and will could include the following: 1. To collect baseline data measuring food and winterization insecurity among vulnerable IDP families. 2. Distribution of Food packages to cover essential needs of 882 families. The food kit lasts 3-4 weeks depends on the size of the family and the age of the members. 3. Distribution of 100 L of Kerosene to cover winterization needs of 882 families. The provided amount of kerosene lasts for 5 weeks if a medium-size kerosene heater is used for about 15 hours per day. 4. To conduct post distribution interviews in order to monitor and evaluate the quality and effectiveness of distribution.

We will distribute Winterization and food assistance. These interventions will provide for the urgent needs of the IDPs due to the lack of resources available to them and lack of economic opportunity making it essential that these resources are provided. As many are not living in acceptable housing, kerosene is very important. The winters are cold and without sufficient heat, the families, in particular the oldest and youngest members, are likely to get sick. Food assistance is important throughout the year, but also as the market prices are reacting to the current economic and political instability the provision of food is important to offset the cost changes and make it possible for the IDPs to have at least the most basic staple food items.
